official-title.#text:
To prohibit an alien who is a national of a country with a widespread Ebola virus outbreak from
			 obtaining a visa and for other purposes.

header.#text: Temporary ban on visas for residents of countries with widespread transmission of the Ebola virus

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or otherwise be
			 admitted to the United States.

text.#text: A covered alien is ineligible to receive a visa from the

A covered alien is ineligible to enter the United States if the alien was lawfully present in the
			 United States pursuant to a visa, departed the United States and visited a
			 designated country, and is seeking to reenter the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall revoke the visa of
			 each covered alien described in subparagraph (A).

text.#text: Subsection (a) shall not apply to an individual who is authorized by the

text.#text: Subsection (a) shall not be construed to require the
is lawfully present in the United States pursuant to that visa; and
does not depart the United States during the term of that visa.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on the spread of the Ebola virus. Each
			 such report shall include—

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and every 30 days thereafter
			 during the period the provisions of this Act are in effect, the

the status of the Ebola virus outbreak in each designated country and the progress made since the
			 last reporting period to contain the outbreak;

a description of the United States assistance to each designated country to combat the Ebola virus
			 and any changes made to levels of assistance as a result of the evolving
			 situation since the last report; and

the reasons that a complete ban on travel to and from designated countries would not be in the
			 national interest of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: certifies that there are no longer any designated countries.

text.#text: The provisions of this Act shall be in effect until the date that is 60 days after the date the
